alert.note: Alert for Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 2:38PM EDT until July 21 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Franklin County in western Maine... Central Coos County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 238 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lancaster, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Colebrook, Errol, Stratford, Dixville, Pittsburg, Columbia, Dummer, Clarksville, Adamstown, Northumberland, Lincoln Plantation, Stark, Wentworth Location, Stewartstown, Parkertown, Lower Cupsuptic and Magalloway Plantation. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
